sentences.en: Although specialized terms can be used, pretentious jargon should be avoided.
sentences.cn: 虽然专业术语可以被使用, 自抬身价的行话应该被避免.

sentences.en: He was restless with pretentious rhetoric.
His response was full of pretentious nonsense.
sentences.cn: 他的答复是一派荒谬的虚夸之词。

sentences.en: Let other people use the more pretentious words.
sentences.cn: 言过其辞的话让别人说吧.

sentences.en: No one has to muster up courage to enter a less pretentious antique shop.
sentences.cn: 对于那些并不使人望而生畏的古玩店,人们不必鼓足勇气就可以进去了.

sentences.en: Pretentious literary style does not prevail now.
sentences.cn: 矫揉造作的文体现在已经不时兴了.

sentences.en: Shadow : You just stole my words. Those people are so pretentious.
sentences.cn: 你刚刚说了我想说的话. 那些人太虚伪了.

sentences.en: She looked at her lover with a pretentious pout.
sentences.cn: 她看着恋人,故作不悦地撅着嘴.

sentences.en: Speaking well of yourself would only make you appear conceited and pretentious.
sentences.cn: 自夸只会使你显得自负和虚伪.

sentences.en: Stripped of their pretentious verbiage, his statements come dangerously close to inviting racial hatred.
sentences.cn: 抛开那些夸大其词的冗词赘语不论，他的言论有挑起种族仇恨的危险。

sentences.en: That's a pretentious name for a dog!
sentences.cn: 狗叫这个名字真够炫的！

sentences.en: The girl was either affected or pretentious.
sentences.cn: 这位姑娘既不虚伪也不做作.

sentences.en: This pub was of a very different type, smaller, less pretentious.
sentences.cn: 这个酒吧风格独特，面积不大，比较低调。

sentences.en: What he was saying must sound both feeble and pretentious.
sentences.cn: 他说的话听起来一定很软弱空洞.

words.tran_cn: 借口；虚假；炫耀；自吹（等于pretence）

trans.tran_cn: 狂妄的，自命不凡的，自负的，虚伪的，矫饰的，做作的
trans.tran_en: if someone or something is pretentious, they try to seem more important, intelligent, or high class than they really are in order to be impressive
